titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the J. Herbert Furth papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Sally DeBauche

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-10-28T15:52-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Rehoused collection, created inventory, edited Scope & Content note and Biog/Hist note.

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, and printed matter, relating to economic theory, and especially to laissez-faire economics and associated concepts of liberty.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Herbert Furth papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1996.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: 1918-1923: Studied law and social science at University of Vienna; founded Association of Democratic Students with Friedrich A. Hayek.
1938-1939: Studied at Harvard University as “Special Student”
1939-1943: Professor of Economics, Lincoln University, Pennsylvania
1943-1966: Economist and Advisor to the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System
1949: Consultant, International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
1960: Visiting Professor of International Finance, International University of Luxembourg
1967-1968: Research Staff, National Bureau of Economic Research
1967-1974: Faculty Associate in Residence, Foreign Service Institute

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collection(s)
relatedmaterial.p: Friedrich A. von Hayek Papers, Hoover Institution Archives; Gottfried Haberler Papers, Hoover Insitution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of speeches and writings, correspondence, and printed matter, relating to economic theory, and especially to laissez-faire economics and associated concepts of liberty. The collection is divided into seven sections, including a Biographical File, Academic Career File, Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve File, Speeches and Writings, Writings by Others, Correspondence, and Printed Matter.

did.unittitle: Excerpt from article related to Furth,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised of correspondence, notes, and biographical materials related to Furth's teaching career at various universities including Catholic University, American University, International University of Luxembourg, and the Foreign Service Institute.

did.unittitle: History of Economic Thought course materials,
History of Economic Thought course syllabus,
International Finance and the American Worker, lecture notes,
"Hayek's Attack on the Concept of Social Justice,"
"The Share of Capital Income in U.S. Economy,"
"Two New Attempts at Finding the 'Middle Way,'"
Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised of correspondence, notes, and reports related to Furth's role as advisor to the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised of reports, articles, monographs, and drafts written by Furth on various topics related to economics.

"Barriers to Direct Investment in Europe as Tools of the U.S. Payments Policy,"
"Capitalism," film strip drafts, notes, and related correspondence,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised of monographs, articles, and reports written by other economists with whom Furth associated in the course of his work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised primarily of Furth's correspondence with other economists on topics related to economics and their writings.
